alert.note: Alert for Lincoln; Oklahoma; Pottawatomie (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 11 at 8:24PM CDT until July 13 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Oklahoma... North Canadian River near Harrah affecting Lincoln, Oklahoma and Pottawatomie Counties. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...North Canadian River near Harrah. * WHEN...From this evening to Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Near bankfull stages occur along the river in eastern Oklahoma County... the southwest corner of Lincoln County... and northwestern Pottawatomie County. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 13.5 feet. - Bankfull stage is 14.0 feet. - Forecast...The North Canadian River is expected to fall. - Action stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 830 AM CDT.
